reviews.content:
Resistance on ERG mode is all over the place.. drop you cadence slightly and the. Increase it again and resistance disappears then comes back, makes for a yo yo ride every time.

When not in ERG mode and changing gear the resistance massively jumps for a couple of seconds each gear change. It’s nothing like riding a real life bike!

reviews.content:
When it works, the experience on this bike is brilliant. It takes Zwift to a whole new level. 

Maybe I’m unlucky but my shifters stopped working within the first few weeks of ownership. 

Support (while helpful) are slow to respond to my issues but they so their best to find a suitable solution. 

I’ve had replacement shifters sent to me that in all honestly are (cosmetically) worse than the ones I’m replacing. To make things worse, they stopped working after just 5 minutes of riding. 

I now have to wait for the support team to respond to my issue again.

I truly hope I can update this review with a more positive outcome in the coming weeks but currently I’m regretting my purchase.
reviews.title: Potentially great, currently disappointing…

reviews.content:
Bike didn’t transmit any data. Cue lots of troubleshooting but still no success. Wahoo then offered an exchange for another reconditioned bike. Great, until it was cancelled on the day of delivery with one hour’s notice.
Grudging £200 discount, but still awaiting a replacement bike over a month after the original order.
I will say that the customer service team have been good, but disappointed with the Wahoo experience.

reviews.content: Out of the box new, the Kickr smart bike v2 does not work. The flywheel does not rotate easily. The flywheel is in contact with the plastic shroud/housing around the driven train and it takes tremendous pedal force to make it move. Support asked me to loosen to screws that secures the shroud around the flywheel, but that did not improve the problem at all. Never mind the fact that I have to make modifications to a new product to compensate for design/manufacturing flaws.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.content: I bought the smart bike months ago for one reason “race mode” .. because I Race weekly on zwift. When I received my smart bike, I was shocked that race mode was no where to be found on the wahoo app/ firmware. So called wahoo and was told that the firmware would be coming out soon. That same week I noticed the sales page for the smart bike was updated that race mode would be coming soon. A few weeks passed and I checked the Wahoo sales page for any updates and I notice the race mode text had been changed from coming soon..too the smart bike has race mode…So I checked the website again and nowhere to be found was an updated firmware. Sooo I called wahoo again and was told the firmware would be coming out soon blah blah and the sales page must have been updated on accident. I noticed that the sales page text would change from race mode being on the bike too race mode coming soon depending on the week…seems like false advertising to me…It’s now the month of May, I bought the bike this winter and still no race mode. Being I already on the direct drive kickR trainer I feel like I wasted $3500 : (
reviews.title: No happy with this purchase

reviews.content: I will NEVER get “certified reconditioned” anything from Wahoo ever again. I’ve been through 2 reconditioned bikes because the first one I received had problems. Mainly a loud, persistent, ear-piercing ringing noise especially pronounced at 75 rpm. I had to wear earplugs or use noise-canceling headphones to use the bike. I contacted Wahoo Support, and they said this high-pitched ringing sound is an “inherent” noise of the motor and is “normal for the KICKR Bike,” but that they would be happy to provide a “courtesy” replacement. They also told me to be aware the replacement will have the same motor sound I’ve been experiencing. Well, I decided to take that chance and asked for the courtesy replacement. The second bike arrived without a problem, but the bike was FILTHY and looked more like a used item than a reconditioned one (see photos). It appeared that NO effort was made to recondition this second bike, and I contacted Wahoo Support right away. Now I’m waiting and waiting and waiting to hear back. In the meantime, I have no training bike and am very unhappy. I am a long-time Wahoo customer, too, because I like the other products. I own a Wahoo bike computer, heart rate monitor, speed and cadence sensors, and have owned 2 Kickr Cores. The issues I’m having with the KICKR Bikes is making me reconsider purchasing any of their products in the future.
reviews.title: Certified Reconditioned is a Joke!

reviews.content:
Ordered before Christmas. First bike sent had a defective left shifter. Replaced by new handle bar/shifters where the right shifter was defective. Company decides entire bike should be replaced and sends 2 boxes for ME to take apart the bike, repackage it and send it back (2-3 hour process). They won't start processing replacement until they have confirmation I have sent back their faulty product. Will be over a month without a bike.
This is what they considerl customer support!!!

reviews.content: Very disappointed with the Kickr Bike after having owned several Kickr trainers. The quality is horrible with poorly machined bolt holes that make driving in bolts almost impossible as I have one bolt that won’t go all the way in. A poorly designed and low quality steer tube clamp that doesn’t secure the handlebars. There are comments all over the forums about this issue. You think for the amount you pay, they would have engineered a better solution once it was known there is a problem. Lastly, was charged for premium shipping only to have a sub-par delivery in which the entire box was dropped and popped open on impact right in front of me. This is not even worth paying $2,000. Would not recommend to a friend.
reviews.title: 3 Reasons Not To Buy

reviews.content: I purchased the V1 right before Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales. Wahoo put the bike on sale but then made even deeper discounts available a few weeks after I made my purchase. I would have appreciated knowing deeper price cuts were coming and would have delayed my purchase by 2 weeks! Also, the discount said shipping was free but I was charged $150. On top of that, there was no option for weekend delivery so I had to take time off work to take delivery. Other than that, the V1 KICKR Bike is excellent and I look forward to many years of enjoying this excellent piece of machinery. I just wish the customer service and delivery was more flexible and accommodating.

reviews.content: Hard to write this review, but I’m upset. I bought the bike certified reconditioned but out of the box it didn’t function. Contacted consumer service - and they’ll replace - but because the bike ships freight and not ground, I need to dismantle the whole thing into smaller boxes, to return and it’s a massive hassle. So far I’ve spent thousands of dollars, and have nothing that works and waiting for a replacement - which I could have got sooner if I paid Wahoo another $1,000! Crazy. This is all not very well thought through. So much for certification.
reviews.title: Beware of “Certified Reconditioned”

reviews.content:
After considering buying a new versus a refurbished one for long, desired to go with refurbished. Before it arrived, the new V1 gotten on sale so I was a bit disappointed because the difference now was only 200.
It arrived without pedals. But also with a defect power adapter . 
Sadly I had prematurely sold my old Kickr core so this was really bothering me. 
Quite quick a new power adapter arrived. I was ready to roll!!
But… the left shifter was defect.
Ended up returning the whole bike and buy a new one on sale really fast, even before I got my money back.
I learned my lesson; never buy refurbished

reviews.content:
I guess if I actually had the Bike, I could leave a review, but over a month after I ordered, the bike still has not arrived to to shipping issues. Still no ETA for the SECOND Bike, the first was declared "lost", even though we know where it was delivered, SEVEN hours from my house. 

The Bike is too heavy to send UPS or FedEx. Wahoo gives the contract for delivery to a half-assed broker who hires randos to deliver the Bike. 

Wahoo needs to contract with an actual freight company, not a broker hiring "hotshot" drivers who can't seem to find a way to deliver something.

Delivery system was snarky, disrespectful and tried to state they attempted a delivery multiple times. No one called (I have a call log), and when they did finally come to deliver it - they attempted to leave it outside not even by the door - and I had to then haul it by myself in. Wahoo...stop using this service.

reviews.content:
I ordered my bike on June 20th and as of July 30th have yet to receive it. I'd love to perform an actual review of the bike but the wahoo customer service has really let me down. I've put in 4 tickets trying to get to the root cause of this and I have no luck. I'm stuck waiting for a $3500 purchase with no Information on when I will finally have it. 

On of the reasons I went with Wahoo was because I heard their customer service was superb. Well my experience has been the exact opposite. I've never once been able to speak with anybody over the phone and only received a response via support tickets. Which one response took 10 days!!

I'll say I recommend a different company because when you're spending this kind of money, customer service should be responsive and transparent about what's going on.

reviews.content: I'm so disappointed and frustrated with this product and especially the customer service. 1st the shipping issue where it took forever and I never knew where my bike was and no one could tell me. When I finally received it nothing worked. The fit app didn't work or any of the fitting tools. I had to do everything manually on my own.I watched many videos, use to work as a bike mechanic and fitter as a side job in a bike shop. I watched many videos about this bike and the fact that you are supposed to be able to replace the handlebars with your own because yours are terrible. This didn't work because there was something wrong with the shifters. They must have been cemented on and would not come off. The design of the shifters where the Allen key is makes it impossible to get the shifters off and the bolts stripped and one shifter broke. So far nothing about this bike worked and all the reasons I bought it failed. So I get in touch with customer service again which is really useless because they take so long to get back to you, always at least 24-48 hours and nothing on the weekends and since I received the bike on Friday I couldn't talk to anyone. When I finally got in touch with someone I requested new shifters and was willing to pay for expedited shipping. 1st they told me they couldn't send just shifters and had to send handlebars. Back to square one. Almost an entire week goes by and no handlebars. I contact customer service again and lose 2 more days waiting to find out the bars were left at the warehouse and never shipped. So customer service now tells me they will expedite shipping. Gee thanks. I ordered this bike on 12/23/21 and it is now 1/18/ 22 and I still can't use it and have no idea if I will ever be able to. I'll probably have to take the bars to a shop so someone else can try to get the shifters off for me since customer service said they couldn't send just shifters. This has been such a frustrating long drawn out experience with a product that still doesn't do anything it supposed to and doesn't do anything I purchased it for.I still don't know when I'll receive the bars or if I'll be able to get the shifters off and onto my bars to work. I don't understand why they can't send me just shifters before the cement them on and make it impossible to get off. All this is so unacceptable and especially after paying $150 for your so called premium shipping where it took forever to receive the bike and then most of the reasons I purchased this bike over others don't work. My level of disappointment and frustration is unexplainable and I'm still out in the dark alone because customer service is almost useless except of course when I was doing my research and spoke to a real person about all my questions and she told me all these things were not an issue and I could do all the things I asked about. At this point I really don't know what to do or should do especially since I don't know when I will get the bars, if they will work or if the fit will be okay. At this point I would have sent it back if it wasn't so difficult to repack.
reviews.title: Totally disappointed and frustrated with the bike and especially customer service.

app.sentence: The fit app didn't work or any of the fitting tools.

reviews.content:
I ordered my bike a month ago. I set it up upon arrival, tried riding for 5 minutes, and then received an error and it stopped working. 

The error kept persisting no matter what I did. 

Support told me to “point a fan at it”. Didn’t work. 

They then told me they would replace it. That was over a week ago, but I haven’t heard anything since. 

Terrible product. Terrible experience. Terrible service.
reviews.title: Arrived broken…and now a giant paper weight

bike.name: bike
bike.sentence: I ordered my bike a month ago.

reviews.content: The first one I received had an issue with bluetooth pairing, resistance was off the charts binding. Received a warranty replacement and this one had the exact opposite problem, no resistance in any gear, paired either via ant+ or bluetooth. Cadence would report 200rpm+ even when spinning with arms to test (at best 60 rpm). Wife wants to return it completely, I'm still hoping Wahoo comes thru with an actual working bike
reviews.title: Great when it works, but hasn't had a working one yet.

reviews.content: The plastic part in the back that holds the flywheel rubs against the wheel. You can't pedal it. It is obvious that the screw mounts don't line up and it was manufactured incorrectly. Mistakes happens, defects happen. But, the fact that this was sold as refurb product is terrible. I call and they tell me to ship it back and they will send me boxes to repack. Still waiting over a week now for the boxes. Takes days for response from customer service. So disappointed. I wanted a new bike and only bought this because new bikes were sold out.
reviews.title: It was broken when received. There was no way they tested it before they sent it.

refurb.name: refurb
refurb.sentence: But, the fact that this was sold as refurb product is terrible.

mount.sentence: It is obvious that the screw mounts don't line up and it was manufactured incorrectly.

reviews.content: I ordered my trainer over 4 months ago on November 4 2020 from Motion Makers Asheville Nc. After multiple phone calls the trainer was never available Christmas ,NewYears, was told that it is on a container off the coast somewhere? Meanwile they charged my credit-card 4 months and Never delivered. I noticed on your website that you have reconditioned bikes that are in the US. Great!! I called Motion Makers to make sure that the trainer is NOT in the US They said it is not in the the US So I ordered Another reconditioned trainer from Wahoo. Now I'm over $7000 on my credit card. Now I just want delivery of the the bike.The day I ordered a reconditioned trainer they sent me an Email that the bike is available and ready for delivery.After 5 months now I'm waiting to get my credit card reimbursed.
reviews.title: The COVIT excuse

bike.name: bike

reviews.content:
When I took the bike out of the box there seemed to be some rubbing on the flywheel when I spun it. I immediately had a bad feeling but hoped that when it was setup and plugged in the rubbing would be resolved. Unfortunately, it wasn't. The rubbing was still there. 
This is extremely poor quality control. At a minimum the flywheel should be turned before the bike goes into the box at the factory.
My support ticket is in with Wahoo so we will see what the fix is. I'm really not looking forward to lugging the unit up from the basement, packing it up, driving it to the shipping location, and carrying it into the counter. The unit weighs nearly 100 lbs and the box is bulky. Its not like boxing up a trainer, It's more like figuring out how to ship a spin bike. 

While I am extremely annoyed and frustrated after spending nearly $4,000 after tax, this is an opportunity for customer support to shine.
I will update my review once my issue gets resolved.
reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
